name: 郭政淳
objective:
本課程主要在培養進階寫作能力，採用功能導向的方式，諸如書函，文章／書本摘要，評論，創作，學術專技報告等專項進行演練。
This course, using a functionally-oriented approach, aims at increasing university-level EFL writing students' English writing skills and developing them into more fluent, confident writers. To achieve this goal, students in this course will have ample opportunities to compose a wide variety of extended writing pieces, including letters, memos, abstracts, reviews, creative writings, and technical reports.
schedule:
Week 1 Introduction  
Week 2 Good Writing in the 21st Century
Week 3 Telling Right from Wrong (I)
Week 4 Telling Right from Wrong (II)
Week 5 Telling Right from Wrong (III)
Week 6 How to Tell a Story (I): Actions
Week 7 How to Tell a Story (II): Characters
Week 8 How to Tell a Story (III): Active/Passive Voice
Week 9 Arcs of Coherence (I): Coherence Relation
Week 10 Arcs of Coherence (II): Pronouns and Voice
Week 11 Writing Clearly (I): Diction
Week 12 Writing Clearly (II): The Curse of Knowledge
Week 13 Writing Elegantly (I): Concision
Week 14 Writing Elegantly (II): Shape
Week 15 Writing Abstracts 
Week 16 Writing Critiques
Week 17 Describing/Explaining Graphs and Tables 
Week 18 Final Exam
scorePolicy:
Written Assignments: 34%
In-Class Activities: 36%
Final Exam: 20%
Writing Portfolio: 10%
materials:
Bizup, Joseph and Joseph M. Williams. 2013. Style: Lessons in Clarity and Grace. 11th ed. Pearson Education.
Pinker, Steven. 2014. The Sense of Style: The Thinking Person’s Guide to Writing in the 21st Century. New York: Penguin Books.
Swales, John M. and Christine B. Freak. 2012. Academic Writing for Graduate Students: Essential Tasks and Skills. 3rd ed. University of Michigan Press.
